amendments.description: Amendment is the reported version of the bill, House Report 118-8 as reported by the Committee on House Administration.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Steil amendment (A001) Agreed to without objection.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 10 printed in House Report 118-7 to add a findings section that states that inspectors general should not less than annually for the next seven years publicly report the number of complaints and tips received, the number of investigations opened, and statistics on how investigations were managed and their disposition by that inspector general related to compliance with the underlying bill and the amendments made by the underlying bill.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Rose amendment (A010) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 9 printed in House Report 118-7 to require mandatory annual training on the requirements of the underlying bill.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Rose amendment (A009) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 6 printed in House Report 118-7 to strike section 2(e).

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A006) Failed by recorded vote: 209 - 221 (Roll no. 139).

amendments.purpose: Amendment sought to strike the Prohibition on Federal employee censorship while using any information system or information technology (as defined under section 11101 of tile 40).

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 4 printed in House Report 118-7 to ensure that federal employees entering into collective bargaining agreements using taxpayer funded time (Section 7131) are prohibited from engaging in censorship of private entities.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Perry amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 207 - 223 (Roll no. 138).

amendments.purpose: Amendment sought to ensure that federal employees entering into collective bargaining agreements using taxpayer funded time (Section 7131) are prohibited from engaging in censorship of private entities.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 8 printed in House Report 118-7 to revise the civil penalty for senior government officials to be $50,000.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Ogles amendment (A008) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 7 printed in House Report 118-7 to revise the disciplinary action consisting of removal, reduction in grade, debarment from federal employment for a period not to exceed 10 years, suspension, or reprimand.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Ogles amendment (A007) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 5 printed in House Report 118-7 to clarify enforcement of obscene matters not protected by the First Amendment.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Good (VA) amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 3 printed in House Report 118-7 to ensure that law enforcement can only take action against unlawful speech.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Bishop (NC) amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 2 printed in House Report 118-7 to make technical edits and to add a conforming clarification for the authorities of the Office of the Special Counsel to ensure that the Act's monetary civil penalties under new section 7382(c)(2) can be fully enforced.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Comer amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 1 printed in House Report 118-7 to require the Attorney General to submit an annual report to Congress evaluating the compliance of the Federal Government with the Protecting Free Speech from Government Interference Act. This amendment provides transparency and insight into any potential violations of the Act by government agencies or employees, and sunsets after 10 years.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Clyde amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: Amendment strikes section 4 of the resolution and redesignates the subesequent section accordingly.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Massie amendment (A001) Agreed to without objection.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 14 printed in House Report 118-4 to strike exceptions to the mandatory inflation forecasting requirement.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Roy amendment (A013) Failed by recorded vote: 199 - 226 (Roll no. 130). (consideration: CR H987-988)

amendments.purpose: Amendment sought to strike exceptions to the mandatory inflation forecasting requirement.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 9 printed in House Report 118-4 to state that nothing in this bill should be construed to suggest that the task of combating inflation and bringing down the cost of living is the sole responibility of the Executive Office of the President.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Lee (NV) amendment (A008) Agreed to by recorded vote: 364 - 56 (Roll no. 129). (consideration: CR H986-987)

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 7 printed in House Report 118-4 to add at the end of section 2(d) the definition to "significant impact" in Sec.2 (a). The term significant impact on inflation means an Executive order was estimated to increase or decrease Consumer Price Index inflation by at least 1% percentage point over the course of a year.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A006) Failed by recorded vote: 187 - 232 (Roll no. 128). (consideration: CR H986)

amendments.purpose: Amendment sought to add at the end of section 2(d) the definition to "significant impact" in Sec.2 (a). The term significant impact on inflation means an Executive order was estimated to increase or decrease Consumer Price Index inflation by at least 1% percentage point over the course of a year.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 6 printed in House Report 118-4 to insert into Sec. 2 (a) line 10 "or" after "inflations and Strikes Sec.(a) lines 11-14. To clarify and make consistent with economic policy on inflationary impacts and effects.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Jackson Lee amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 181 - 236 (Roll no. 127). (consideration: CR H985-986)

amendments.purpose: Amendment sought to insert into Sec. 2 (a) line 10 "or" after "inflations and strikes Sec.(a) lines 11-14. To clarify and make consistent with economic policy on inflationary impacts and effects.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 3 printed in House Report 118-4 to require the inflation estimate to be made publicly available by publishing on the OMB website.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Boebert amendment (A003) Agreed to by recorded vote: 386 - 31 (Roll no. 126). (consideration: CR H984-985)

amendments.purpose: Amendment requires the inflation estimate to be made publicly available by publishing on the OMB website.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 1 printed in House Report 118-4 to require that the inflationary report take into account the spending patterns of military personnel, rural areas, and farm households.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Bost amendment (A001) Agreed to by recorded vote: 324 - 83 (Roll no. 125). (consideration: CR H983-984)

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 15 printed in House Report 118-4 to require the statement estimating inflationary effects to break down the type of inflation to the CPI's major categories of Food, Energy, and All Items Less Food and Energy.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Yakym amendment (A014) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendments.description: An amendment numbered 13 printed in House Report 118-4 to require a detailed description of any impact on the consumer price index.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Perry amendment (A012) Agreed to by voice vote.
